column4: hey, i installed epiphany and noticed that the default search engine is the BRITISH google, even though ubuntu knows i live in australia. has this happened to anyone else?
that sort of thing has happened to me before.
its a bug with the epiphany package, yeah? rather than a bug in the ubuntu location settigns..
yeah.  my Open Office was giving me everything in Greek.  It's minor package bug, nothing serious.
how do i fix the epiphany problem?
let me play around with Epiphany for a second.
actually, its obvious how to fix it. ideally i'd like to delete it, but then which smart bookmark does epiphany use as default
can't you just set a new one?

if you just chuck some search terms into the location bar, it searches using "Search the web", but i'm wondering if you delete that bookmark, how it picks the "default" one to search with in that condition
i see what you mean.  mine defaults to the us google site.
i think I may have an answer.  Go to "Edit Bookmarks"
right click on "search the web" and select properties.  you can change the address from there.  hope that works.
sorry that didn't work.  not sure how to go about that.  If I were you, I'd simply make a new bookmark out of www.google.com.au
i can do that, i'm just wondering how to make that bookmark the default one instead of the british one
yeah, that's an issue.  not sure how to change that.  firefox a bit heavy on your system?
